title: Simple circuits - is bulb lit in bulb-resistor ckt

content.question: A circuit contains a battery, a resistor, a lightbulb, and an open switch connected as shown in the figure. Which of the following correctly describes if the bulb is lit or not lit and provides a correct justification?

choices.label: The bulb is lit. There is a path between the bulb and the battery for charge to flow.
The bulb is lit. Charge carriers moving through the resistor also move through the bulb.
The bulb is not lit. The open switch prevents the flow of charge.
The bulb is not lit. The resistor prevents charge carriers from getting to the bulb.

content.answer: The bulb is not lit. The open switch prevents the flow of charge.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
